attachments.text: You know about responsive images. It's about the image syntax in HTML. If you give it the right information in the right syntax, you can get the browser to

text: <@U026PLK4S> Do you know when the home page will be ready?
today
Awesome. Thanks.

<@U026PLK4S> / <@U0260V1BX> I just got a chance to look at the plugin chosen for the scroll control and noticed it the way it’s built it won’t let the user scroll two sections on one swipe. So, for example, if I want to go from section 1 to 3 I have to scroll to 2, wait for the animation to finish and then I have to scroll one more time. Check out the “who is using” at th bottom of this page <https://github.com/alvarotrigo/fullPage.js>

So my question is, from a UX/usability standpoint are you OK with this?

attachments.title: alvarotrigo/fullPage.js
attachments.text: fullPage.js - fullPage plugin by Alvaro Trigo. Create full screen pages fast and simple

text: hey <@U02618EV1> thats a great question. I am not immediately concerned but i would like to test this out with our actual content and see how it feels.
Ok, only asking b/c I’m not sure if we can “turn that off.” So if we were to use it and didn’t like it I’m not sure what the path to another library may be.
Again, I probably need to study how this thing works 100%
<@U02618EV1>: want to look at what I have so far?
k
cool i’ll be around
hey Gaston, good eye, and thanks for pointing this out
i’m perfectly okay with it
Thanks. Just had a quick chat with Melissa and she’s also ok with it.
i think it’s really important to have that pause in the Info section
i think my biggest concern is if someone wants to get down to the footer quickly for some reason. but i think thats an edge case that we don’t nec. need to solve for.
Since I have you both here, are we also using this for mobile?
no
for touch screens we’ll eliminate snapping
and instead have a “launch slideshow” button
<https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/spa/ra93brplpldred1/6ezc4q55.png>

Cool. Maybe some time later this week lets chat about mobile/touch screens. Chrome books, the new Microsoft pcs and tablets are touchscreens but not “mobile devices.” So maybe we’ll need make some decisions for those devices.
yes, definitely
<@U02618EV1>, would you rather have mobile project page comped and speced or home page comped and speced first?
finishing slideshow types right now
i only ask because it sounds like you may be in proejct page land
or we can wait for all things mobile until we’re further along, like hercules.  totally up to you.
The latter sounds like it may work better.

<@U02618EV1> if its ok we can make those decisions once we have something to look at on different devices. My gut says that the fullpage.js approach will work just fine on tablets and larger touch screens, and we’ll be able to let the mobile layout be for truly mobile devices.

RE: mobile vs touch, historically, we’ve called “mobile” devices of a certain size because we were only changing layouts. With this project we’re also changing functionality that may affect UX so, unfortunately, we may need to be more granular.
<@U0260V1BX> I agree. That’s seem like a good approach.
it seems like this library works fairly well with touch.
maybe we can switch to “mobile” based on a combo of device type and width
not just width
anyway, that’s really good info to consider Gaston.
i love working with developers that ask me these kinds of questions.
:wink:
hey <@U026PLK4S> what did you decide was the ideal character limit for captions?
yes!
<@U026PLK4S> is there a character limit for anything else we know of yet?
i’d say there probably should be one for intro as well as artist bio

right, there probably should be for the intro, but i’m not confident enough to try to guess what that might be. I think that section can handle quite a bit of text, so even if we did have to introduce one, it wouldn’t be too bad. In fact, some of the intros have a “short” version.
but i’d want to see what it can handle in the build
Cool, makes sense. I'll put the 450 caption limit in the CMS now and we'll wait to assess others once we've got something up and running.
<@U02613K0X> i’m working on some CMS wires for you. i should have the beginnings of something (at least the project page) for you tomorrow.
oh wow okay
sounds good
I've finished the whole CMS front end for magnum already, but I'm happy to make as many changes to it as time allows
<@U02613K0X>, same goes for Text Only slide. Probably will need a cap, but don’t know what that will be yet.

<@U02618EV1> / <@U02HAJ6JF> : just did some housekeeping to the NAS. It’s much better now. Nothing big has changed, but why don’t you dump what you got and start fresh. I’ve also included Homepage Flat Comps & Spec, as well as .PSDs.
Tomorrow, I’ll get some style styles going, and then Maddie and I will finish up the Nav and the Footer.
nice nice nice! thanks matt+maddie
Thanks Matt.
<http://s3.amazonaws.com/rapgenius/1379638021_shit-just-got-real.jpg>
